A.title: Format Version
A.description: A version that tells minecraft what type of data format can be expected when reading this file.

C.title: Climate
C.description: Describes temperature, humidity, precipitation, etc.  Biomes without this component will have default values.

downfall.title: Downfall
downfall.description: Amount that precipitation affects colors and block changes.

snow_accumulation.title: Snow Accumulation
snow_accumulation.description: Minimum and maximum snow level, each multiple of 0.125 is another snow layer.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Temperature affects a variety of visual and behavioral things, including snow and ice placement, sponge drying, and sky color.

D.title: Creature Spawn Probability
D.description: Probability that creatures will spawn within the biome when a chunk is generated.

probability.title: Probability
probability.description: Probabiltity between [0.0, 0.75] of creatures spawning within the biome on chunk generation.

E.title: Humidity
E.description: Forces a biome to ether always be humid or never humid. Humidity effects the spread chance, and spread rate of fire in the biome

is_humid.title: Is Humid
is_humid.description: Whether or not the biome is humid.

tint.description: Tint color used in this biome on the map.

type.title: GrassType
type.description: Controls the type of grass tint to use.

type.title: GrassType
type.description: Controls the type of grass tint to use.

F.title: Map Tints
F.description: Sets the color grass and foliage will be tinted by in this biome on the map.

grass.title: Grass
grass.description: Controls whether the grass will use a custom tint color or a noise based tint color.

foliage.title: Foliage
foliage.description: Sets the color foliage will be tinted by in this biome on the map.

additionalProperties.title: State Value
additionalProperties.description: The key of property is the name of the block state/property, the value must be the same as the block properties accepted values.

tags.description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false that can be used to query for blocks with certain tags.

G.title: Mountain Parameters
G.description: Noise parameters used to drive mountain terrain generation in Overworld.

steep_material_adjustment.title: Steep Material Adjustment
steep_material_adjustment.description: Defines surface material for steep slopes.

material.title: Material
material.description: Block type use as steep material.

top_slide.title: Top Slide
top_slide.description: Controls the density tapering that happens at the top of the world to prevent terrain from reaching too high.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: If false, top slide will be disabled. If true, other parameters will be taken into account

BA.title: Nether Generation Rules
BA.description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the nether.

target_temperature.title: Target Temperature
target_temperature.description: Temperature with which this biome should selected, relative to other biomes.

target_humidity.title: Target Humidity
target_humidity.description: Humidity with which this biome should selected, relative to other biomes.

target_altitude.title: Target Altitude
target_altitude.description: Altitude with which this biome should selected, relative to other biomes.

target_weirdness.title: Target Weirdness
target_weirdness.description: Weirdness with which this biome should selected, relative to other biomes.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Weight with which this biome should selected, relative to other biomes.

oneOf.description: Array of any size. If an array, each entry can be a Biome name string, or an array of size 2, where the first entry is a Biome name and the second entry is a positive integer representing how that Biome is weighted against other entries. If no weight is provided, a weight of 1 is used..
oneOf.title: Block Reference

items.title: Weight
items.description: A positive integer representing how that Biome is weighted against other entries..

BB.title: Overworld Generation Rules
BB.description: Control how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the overworld.

hills_transformation.title: Hills Transformation
hills_transformation.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a hilly biome.

mutate_transformation.title: Mutate Transformation
mutate_transformation.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a mutated biome.

river_transformation.title: River Transformation
river_transformation.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a river biome (if not the Vanilla 'river' biome).

shore_transformation.title: Shore Transformation
shore_transformation.description: What biome to switch to when adjacent to an ocean biome.

generate_for_climates.title: Generate For Climates
generate_for_climates.description: Controls the world generation climate categories that this biome can spawn for. A single biome can be associated with multiple categories with different weightings.

items.description: An array of any size containing arrays of exactly two elements where the first entry is the climate category and the second is a positive integer.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight with which this biome should be selected, relative to other biomes in the same category.

BC.title: Overworld Height
BC.description: Noise parameters used to drive terrain height in the Overworld.

items.title: Depth
items.description: More negative means deeper underwater, while more positive means higher.

items.title: Scale
items.description: Affects how much noise changes as it moves from the surface.

noise_type.title: Noise Type
noise_type.description: Specifies a preset based on a built-in setting rather than manually using noise_params.

BD.title: Partially Frozen
BD.description: Component will impact the temperature in a frozen biome, causing some areas to not be frozen. Ex: patchy ice, patchy snow

BE.title: Replace Biomes
BE.description: Replaces a specified portion of one or more Minecraft biomes.

replacements.description: List of biome replacement configurations. Retroactively adding a new replacement to the front of this list will cause the world generation to change. Please add any new replacements to the end of the list.

items.title: Biome Replacement
items.description: Represents the replacement information used to determine the placement of the overriding biome.

dimension.description: Dimension in which this replacement can happen.

amount.description: Noise value used to determine whether or not the replacement is attempted, similar to a percentage. Must be in the range (0.0, 1.0].

targets.description: Biomes that are going to be replaced by the overriding biome.

noise_frequency_scale.description: Scaling value used to alter the frequency of replacement attempts. A lower frequency will mean a bigger contiguous biome area that occurs less often. A higher frequency will mean smaller contiguous biome areas that occur more often. Must be in the range (0.0, 100.0].

BG.title: Molang Number
BG.description: The minecraft molang definition that results in a float.

BF.title: Surface Material Adjustments
BF.description: Specify fine-detail changes to blocks used in terrain generation (based on a noise function).

adjustments.title: Adjustments
adjustments.description: All adjustments that match the column's noise values will be applied in the order listed.

items.title: Adjustment
items.description: The specific blocks used for this surface adjustment.

height_range.title: Height Range
height_range.description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: The specific blocks used for this surface adjustment.

top_material.title: Top Material
top_material.description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

mid_material.title: Mid Material
mid_material.description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

sea_floor_material.title: Sea Floor Material
sea_floor_material.description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

foundation_material.title: Top Materials
foundation_material.description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome when this adjustment is active.

sea_material.title: Top Materials
sea_material.description: Controls the block type used in the bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

noise_range.title: Noise Range
noise_range.description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

noise_frequency_scale.title: Noise Frequency Scale
noise_frequency_scale.description: The scale to multiply by the position when accessing the noise value for the material adjustments.

BH.title: Surface Builder
BH.description: Controls the materials used for terrain generation.

builder.title: Builder
builder.description: Controls the block types used for terrain generation.

top_material.title: Top Material
top_material.description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome.

mid_material.title: Mid Material
mid_material.description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome.

sea_floor_material.title: Sea Floor Material
sea_floor_material.description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome.

foundation_material.title: Foundation Material
foundation_material.description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome.

sea_material.title: Sea Material
sea_material.description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome.

sea_floor_depth.title: Sea Floor Depth
sea_floor_depth.description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur.

top_material.title: Top Material
top_material.description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome.

mid_material.title: Mid Material
mid_material.description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome.

sea_floor_material.title: Sea Floor Material
sea_floor_material.description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome.

foundation_material.title: Foundation Material
foundation_material.description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome.

sea_material.title: Sea Material
sea_material.description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome.

sea_floor_depth.title: Sea Floor Depth
sea_floor_depth.description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur.

max_puddle_depth_below_sea_level.title: Max Puddle Depth Below Sea Level
max_puddle_depth_below_sea_level.description: Controls the depth at which surface level blocks can be replaced with water for puddles. The number represents the number of blocks below sea level that we will go down to look for a surface block.

top_material.title: Top Material
top_material.description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome.

mid_material.title: Mid Material
mid_material.description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome.

sea_floor_material.title: Sea Floor Material
sea_floor_material.description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome.

foundation_material.title: Foundation Material
foundation_material.description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome.

sea_material.title: Sea Material
sea_material.description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome.

sea_floor_depth.title: Sea Floor Depth
sea_floor_depth.description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur.

bryce_pillars.title: Bryce Pillars
bryce_pillars.description: Whether the mesa generates with pillars.

has_forest.title: Has Forest
has_forest.description: Places coarse dirt and grass at high altitudes.

ceiling_materials.title: Ceiling Materials
ceiling_materials.description: Materials used for the surface ceiling.

floor_materials.title: Floor Materials
floor_materials.description: Materials used for the surface floor.

sea_material.title: Sea Material
sea_material.description: Material used to replace air blocks below sea level.

foundation_material.title: Foundation Material
foundation_material.description: Material used to repalce solid blocks that are not surface blocks.

beach_material.title: Beach Material
beach_material.description: Material used to decorate surface near sea level.

BI.title: Tags
BI.description: Attach arbitrary string tags to this biome.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Array of string tags used by other systems such as entity spawning

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The identifier for this biome. The name must include a namespace and must not use the Minecraft namespace unless overriding a Vanilla biome.
